title: 1981 Icelandic Cup
text:
The 1981 Icelandic Cup was the 22nd edition of the National Football Cup.
It took place between 26 May 1980 and 30 August 1981, with the final played at <a href="Laugardalsv%C3%B6llur">Laugardalsvöllur</a> in <a href="Reykjavik">Reykjavik</a>. The cup was important, as winners qualified for the <a href="UEFA%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">UEFA Cup Winners' Cup</a> (if a club won both the league and the cup, the defeated finalists would take their place in the Cup Winners' Cup).
The 10 clubs from the <a href="1980%20%C3%9Arvalsdeild">1. Deild</a> entered in the last 16, with clubs from lower tiers entering in the three preliminary rounds. Teams played one-legged matches. In case of a draw, the match was replayed at the opposition's ground.
The final was a rematch of the previous season - <a href="Fram%20Reykjavik">Fram Reykjavik</a> and <a href="%C3%8DBV%20Vestmannaeyjar">ÍBV Vestmannaeyjar</a> meeting, but on this occasion it was the club from <a href="Vestmannaeyjar">Vestmannaeyjar</a> who qualified for Europe. IBV won the Icelandic Cup for the fourth time.
